author: xccj
title: A Snowmobile in the Jungle?
review:
Winzar the wolf has his very own polybad set, where he gets to slide around on his hound-like snowmobile thing.  This leads to my first question: what’s the point of a snowmobile when the world of Chima clearly takes place in a jungle? 

First of, some of the parts in this set are nice., including two of the new silver blade pieces, a new 1x2 inverted bracket piece, and a trans blue CHI crystal.  Still, the minifigure is probably the best part of this set. Winzar the wolf only appears in one other set so far, so he’s fairly exclusive.  He has printing on his legs, torso (front and back) and even both sides of his minifig head, even though most of it is covered up by the detailed wolf head piece, which gives him a snout, hair, and pointy ears.

The most controversial part of Winzar is the three red scratches he has over his left eye, which leaves him permanently squinting on that side.  Is this really a bloody battle scar, because that seems rather dark for LEGO.  It reminds me of the Bionicle character Pridak, who also has red marks on his white face.  For him, it was explained away as just red decorative paint, but will that be the same explanation for Winzar, or did Lego really give him such a violent injury?  This is something I found odd.

At first glance, the little snowmobile seems a little tame.  I wasn't really expecting much from a polybag set, but it doesn't have any exceptional pieces or building style.  However, without the rider, I noticed that there is a reason for the design; it looks like a wolf head!  The red studs with cheese slopes on the back represent eyes and ears, while the slopes on the front represent the snout.  Even the red plates beneath the grey wedges could represent a mouth.  It’s not the most detailed design ever, but I’m impressed that they were able to convey the look with so few pieces.  It loses a bit of the image when Winzar is sitting on it, but it’s still a cool design.

So is this a polybag worth getting?  Yes, I think it is.  Winzar is still a nice wolf-fig, and the design of the snowmobile to look like a wolf’s head with so few pieces is ingenious.  I found this one at a Target, so hopefully it will be widespread enough that everyone who wants one can easily pick it up.

author: deadeye55
title: Must be a warm winter
review:
LEGO: Legends of Chima: 30251-1: Winzar's Pack Patrol

Pieces: 38

Release year: 2013

P/P: $0.105 (got mine for 3.99)

 

 

Box/Instructions

Comes in a poly bag and I was lucky to just happen to find it hidden behind boxes in one of my local Targets. Not much to be said about the polybag. The front shows Winzar on his snowmobilish machine going through what looks like a jungle in Chima (must have been a warm winter).

Instructions are what you would expect from a polybag. Small fold up instructions printed on both sides.

Parts

A good mixture of parts here. Nothing totally outstanding, but it does have some nice dark red pieces, and two silver/grey blades. Can't complain here about the contents in a polybag.

Minifigures

All Chima minifigures are superb. And being able to get one with a small machine for $4 is great. Winzar is a wolf with some scratch marks on his molded face that also continue to the printed head. The head and torso are printed on both sides and have a great amount of detail on them.

The build

The real question is here as to what Winzar is actually riding. To me it seems like a snowmobile, however he is in a jungle. However it doesn't use wheels, which makes for a great contrast to a lot of models that do, especially since all the other wolf ones do. The build is simple, yet I really like how LEGO still focused on making the machine look like a wolfs head. I think they did a great job with that and the nose and eyes are clearly visible.

The completed model

The back of the machine has a tilting hinge for the blades giving the machine some poseability. Also the skis are place in the front attached to a bone to make it look like a bone is in the wolfs mouth.

Summary

Great model over all considering it is in a polybag. Worth getting a couple of them if given the chance.

 

Parts: 10/10

Minifigure: 10/10

Build: 9.5/10

Completed Model: 10/10

Playability: 8/10

Price: 9/10


~Deadeye55
